poem:
**Interstellar Pause in Scotland**

Here, on Earth, where galaxies weave  
through the heather and ancient stone,  
we wander Dumfries—a space imagined  
from miners' toil. I stand between  
the glow of Andromeda and quiet fields,  
the sun a distant constellated friend,  
and watch the hills breathe beneath  
a universe wrought by human hands.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Beam me up, Scotland: a journey into outer space in Dumfries and Galloway The sun warms my face as I pause between the Andromeda and Milky Way galaxies to gaze at the rolling hills of Dumfries and Galloway beyond. I am not, surprisingly enough, in outer space. I’m at the Crawick Multiverse, a cosmos-themed land art installation in the south of Scotland that was built on the site of an old open-cast coal mine and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
